thread.title: Report: Ashbrook center Isaiah Whaley to transfer to private school in Charlotte
thread.title_full: Report: Ashbrook center Isaiah Whaley to transfer to private school in Charlotte

author: Richard Walker
title: Report: Ashbrook center Isaiah Whaley to transfer to private school in Charlotte
text: Follow @JRWalk22 Posted Oct. 4, 2015 at 10:32 pm Updated at 8:37 AM GASTONIA – A week after being charged with stealing a coat from a clothing store, two-time All-Gazette basketball player Isaiah Whaley is reportedly transferring from Ashbrook to a private school in Charlotte. A 6-foot-9, 200-pound center, Whaley will be leaving Ashbrook for Evelyn Mack Academy, according to a twitter posting by prephoopreport.com owner Rick Lewis. Whaley averaging 13.7 points, 9.1 rebounds and 4.5 blocks as a sophomore in 2013-14 and 17.5 points, 9.1 rebounds and 4.7 blocks as a junior. The Green Wave went 18-11 and 23-4, respectively, with last year’s team finishing as N.C. 3A runner-up as Fayetteville Terry Sanford. Whaley is considered one of the top seniors in the state and has been offered scholarships by Appalachian State, Charlotte, East Carolina, Georgia, Middle Tennessee, Towson, Virginia Tech and Western Carolina. On Sept. 25, Whaley and Ashbrook teammate Malik Gingles were charged with one count each of misdemeanor larceny after they were accused of stealing a coat from Kohl’s department story at 3648 E. Franklin Blvd., in Gastonia. Ashbrook practice is slated to begin Nov. 2 and Whaley is scheduled to appear before a Gaston County judge Nov. 23. Richard Walker: 704-869-1841; twitter.com/jrwalk22
